item.title: 美国驱逐舰、加拿大护卫舰过境台湾海峡-美军
item.description:
The U.S. destroyer USS Rafael Peralta and a Royal Canadian Navy frigate HMCS Ottawa transited the Taiwan Strait on Wednesday, the U.S. 7th Fleet said in a statement, making their third joint transit in the region since June.翻译:美国第七舰队在一份声明中表示，美国驱逐舰“拉斐尔·佩拉尔塔”号和加拿大皇家海军护卫舰“渥太华”号周三穿越台湾海峡，这是自六月以来第三次联合穿越台湾海峡。

Taiwan's defence ministry said the two warships sailed through the Taiwan Strait in a northerly direction on Wednesday night, adding it monitored the movement and the situation was "normal."翻译:台湾国防部表示，两艘军舰周三晚间向北航行通过台湾海峡，并补充说，国防部监测了这一行动，情况“正常”。

China followed and monitored the transit and handled the situation in line with the law and regulations, the People's Liberation Army Eastern Theater Command said in a statement on Thurday.翻译:中国人民解放军东部战区周四在一份声明中表示，中方对过境情况进行跟踪监控，并依法依规进行处理。

The U.S. and Canadian navies made a similar transit in September.翻译:美国和加拿大海军在九月也进行了类似的过境。

In June, the U.S. navy released a video of what it called an "unsafe interaction" in the Taiwan Strait in which a Chinese warship crossed in front of a U.S. destroyer. Chinese foreign ministry said its military's measures were completely reasonable, legitimate, and professional and safe.翻译:6月，美国海军发布了一段所谓的台湾海峡“不安全互动” 视频，其中一艘中国军舰从一艘美国驱逐舰前面穿过。中国外交部表示，中国军队的举措完全合理、合法、专业、安全。

The U.S. destroyer USS Chung-Hoon and Canadian frigate Montreal were conducting a "routine" transit of the strait in June.翻译:六月，美国驱逐舰“忠云号”和加拿大护卫舰“蒙特利尔号”正在该海峡进行“例行”穿越。

Reporting by Albee Zhang and Ryan Woo in Beijing and Yi-Mou Lee in Taiwan; Editing by Simon Cameron-Moore翻译:北京的 Albee 张和 Ryan Woo 以及台湾的 Yi-Mou Lee 的报道；西蒙·卡梅伦-摩尔 编辑

item.title: 菲律宾警方追捕六名被绑架中国公民
item.description:
Philippine authorities were trying to track the whereabouts of six Chinese nationals who were abducted in the capital region this week, police said on Thursday.翻译:警方周四表示，菲律宾当局正在试图追踪本周在首都地区被绑架的六名中国公民的下落。

Police anti-kidnapping chief Cosme Abrenica said authorities were investigating the abduction of nine people on Monday in an upscale neighbourhood in southern Metro Manila. Six of the victims were Chinese, who remain missing, and three were Filipino who were released shortly after they were abducted.翻译:警方反绑架负责人科斯梅·阿布伦尼卡 (Cosme Abrenica) 表示，当局正在调查周一在马尼拉大都会南部一个高档社区发生的九人绑架事件。其中六名受害者是中国人，目前仍然失踪，三名受害者是菲律宾人，他们在被绑架后不久就被释放。

"We have no information if it's kidnap-for-ransom, kidnapping or what the motive is. We haven't established it yet," Abrenica said.翻译:“我们不知道这是否是绑架勒索、绑架或动机是什么。我们还没有确定，”阿布雷尼卡说。

Abrenica did not disclose the identities of the victims or give any details on their status in the Philippines.翻译:Abrenica 没有透露受害者的身份，也没有提供有关他们在菲律宾的状况的任何详细信息。

Philip Aguilar, the police chief of Calauan town where the Filipino victims were recovered, said one of the survivors told them the kidnappers had barged into their home before dawn on Monday.翻译:菲律宾受害者被找到的卡劳安镇警察局长菲利普·阿吉拉尔表示，其中一名幸存者告诉他们，绑匪周一黎明前闯入了他们的家。

The Chinese embassy in Manila said it had noted a request from Reuters for comment.翻译:中国驻马尼拉大使馆表示，已注意到路透社的置评请求。

While police said the motive for this week's kidnapping was not known, China has in the past complained to the Philippines about its citizens being lured to work in online gaming firms and then being cheated, extorted and exposed to “modern slavery”.翻译:虽然警方表示本周绑架的动机尚不清楚，但中国过去曾向菲律宾抱怨其公民被引诱到网络游戏公司工作，然后遭到欺骗、勒索并遭受“现代奴隶制”。

Reporting by Mikhail Flores; editing by Robert Birsel翻译:米哈伊尔·弗洛雷斯报道；罗伯特·伯塞尔编辑

item.title: 菲律宾指责中国侵入其海域
item.description:
The Philippine foreign ministry on Thursday accused China of intruding into its waters after an incident involving the two countries' military vessels at a disputed shoal in the South China Sea earlier this week.翻译:本周早些时候，两国军舰在南海争议浅滩发生事件，菲律宾外交部周四指责中国侵入菲律宾海域。

The Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) said the Chinese military's claim that a Philippine military ship "illegally entered" waters near the Scarborough Shoal "has no legal basis and only serves to raise tensions" in the disputed waterway.翻译:外交部表示，中国军方关于菲律宾军舰“非法进入”黄岩岛附近海域的说法“没有法律依据，只会加剧争议航道的紧张局势”。

"It is China that is intruding into Philippine waters," the foreign ministry said in a statement.翻译:外交部在一份声明中表示：“是中国入侵了菲律宾海域。”

The Philippines and China both lay claim to the Scarborough Shoal but sovereignty has never been established and it remains effectively under Beijing's control since it seized it from Manila in 2012.翻译:菲律宾和中国都声称对黄岩岛拥有主权，但主权从未确立，自2012年从马尼拉手中夺取黄岩岛以来，黄岩岛实际上仍处于北京的控制之下。

The DFA said the shoal, which it calls "Bajo de Masinloc" is within the Philippines' exclusive economic zone and the country has sovereign rights and jurisdiction over it.翻译:外交部表示，这个被称为“Bajo de Masinloc”的浅滩位于菲律宾专属经济区内，菲律宾对其拥有主权权利和管辖权。

"The Philippines has consistently demanded that Chinese vessels in Bajo de Masinloc leave the area immediately," the foreign ministry said.翻译:菲律宾外交部表示：“菲律宾一贯要求在巴霍德马辛洛克的中国船只立即离开该地区。”

The shoal, located 200km (124 miles) off the Philippines, was part of an arbitration claim filed by Manila at an international tribunal. The court ruled in 2016 that Beijing's claim to 90% of the South China Sea had no basis under international law, but China has refused to recognise the ruling.翻译:该浅滩距离菲律宾 200 公里（124 英里），是马尼拉向国际法庭提出的仲裁索赔的一部分。该法院于2016年裁定，北京对南海90%海域的主权主张没有国际法依据，但中国拒绝承认这一裁决。

Reporting by Mikhail Flores; Editing by Kanupriya Kapoor翻译:米哈伊尔·弗洛雷斯报道；卡努普里亚·卡普尔 编辑

item.title: 北京入冬晚一周，华北地区天气温暖
item.description:
Winter is expected to arrive late, and suddenly in Beijing this year as daytime temperatures hovered above 20 degrees Celsius (68 Fahrenheit), bathing the capital in a warm smog, while other parts of China basked in record highs above 30C.翻译:预计今年北京的冬天会来得较晚，而且会突然到来，白天气温徘徊在 20 摄氏度（68 华氏度）以上，让首都沐浴在温暖的雾霾之中，而中国其他地区的气温则创下了 30 摄氏度以上的历史新高。

The official start of winter in the capital could come on Nov. 6, state-run Beijing Daily reported on Wednesday, almost a week later than in previous years, with average temperatures expected to dive more than 10C.翻译:据国营《北京日报》周三报道，首都冬季可能会在11月6日正式开始，比往年晚了近一周，平均气温预计将下降10摄氏度以上。

The weather in many parts of China had stayed stubbornly warm entering November, with cities in eastern and central provinces such as Shandong, Anhui, Jiangsu and Henan still logging temperatures above 30C.翻译:进入11月，我国多地天气持续高温，山东、安徽、江苏、河南等东部和中部省份城市气温仍然在30℃以上。

As of 2 p.m. (0600 GMT) on Wednesday, more than 600 meteorological stations across China had seen temperatures shatter historical highs for November, according to the official Xinhua news agency.翻译:据官方新华社报道，截至周三下午 2 点（格林威治标准时间 0600），中国各地 600 多个气象站的气温打破了 11 月份的历史新高。

Beijing logged its second-warmest October last month in over 60 years. Temperatures also averaged 3.4C higher than normal in the last 10 days of the month, a record for the same period since 1961.翻译:上个月，北京经历了 60 多年来第二个最热的 10 月。本月最后 10 天平均气温也比正常水平高出 3.4 摄氏度，创下 1961 年以来同期最高纪录。

In tandem with the warm weather, smog has also shrouded Beijing and its surrounding areas for days.翻译:随着天气转暖，雾霾也连续多日笼罩北京及周边地区。

On Thursday, heavy and dense fog is forecast to envelop regions including Beijing and surrounding cities for the fifth day, with visibility dropping below 200 metres in parts of Hebei province, China's National Meteorological Center said.翻译:中国国家气象中心预计，周四，北京及周边城市将连续第五天出现大雾，河北部分地区能见度降至200米以下。

Experts quoted by state media say the recent "rare" summer-like weather was due to weaker-than-usual cold air currents, which had also led to persistent hazy weather with heavy air pollution shrouding the city.翻译:官方媒体援引专家的话称，近期出现“罕见”的夏季天气是由于冷气流弱于平常，这也导致持续的雾霾天气，严重的空气污染笼罩着这座城市。

In coming days, temperatures across northern China are expected to drop sharply. Northeastern cities such as Shenyang, Changchun and Harbin would see a sharp drop of more than 15C.翻译:未来几天，华北地区气温预计将大幅下降。沉阳、长春、哈尔滨等东北城市气温将大幅下降15℃以上。

Other cities such as Beijing, Zhengzhou, Jinan, Xian and Shijiazhuang will see a sudden decline of 10C to 15C.翻译:北京、郑州、济南、西安、石家庄等城市气温将骤降10℃至15℃。

Reporting by Ethan Wang, Ryan Woo and Shanghai Newsroom; Editing by Simon Cameron-Moore翻译:Ethan Wang、Ryan Woo 和上海新闻编辑室的报道；西蒙·卡梅伦-摩尔 编辑

item.title: 鲍威尔寄希望于结束加息，亚洲股市和债券上涨
item.description:
Summary:
  • Markets trim bets on Dec, Jan rate hikes翻译:市场削减对12月和1月加息的押注
  • Markets now see rate cuts beginning June 2024翻译:市场预计 2024 年 6 月开始降息
  • Apple results later in the day; U.S. nonfarm payrolls on Friday翻译:苹果公司将于当天晚些时候公布结果；周五美国非农就业数据

Asian shares and bonds extended a global rally on Thursday as a non-committal Federal Reserve Chair had markets double down on bets that U.S. interest rates have peaked and cuts are on the way.翻译:亚洲股市和债券周四延续了全球涨势，美联储主席不置可否，令市场加倍押注美国利率已见顶且即将降息。

Investors are now awaiting the results from Apple (AAPL.O) later in the day, a bellwether for consumer demand and the tech sector. The Cupertino California-based company is expected to report a 1% decrease in quarterly revenue.翻译:投资者目前正在等待当天晚些时候苹果公司(AAPL.O)的业绩，该公司是消费者需求和科技行业的风向标。这家总部位于加利福尼亚州库比蒂诺的公司预计季度收入将下降 1%。

MSCI's broadest index of Asia-Pacific shares outside Japan (.MIAPJ0000PUS) surged 1.7% to the highest level in one week. Tokyo's Nikkei (.N225) gained 1.4% to cross the 32,000 level for the first time in two weeks.翻译:MSCI 日本以外最广泛的亚太股市指数(.MIAPJ0000PUS)飙升 1.7%，创一周最高水平。东京日经指数(.N225)上涨 1.4%，两周来首次突破 32,000 点。

China's blue chips (.CSI300) were 0.3% higher, while Hong Kong's Hang Seng index (.HSI) jumped 1.7%.翻译:中国蓝筹股(.CSI300)上涨 0.3%，香港恒生指数(.HSI)上涨 1.7%。

Stock futures in Europe and U.S. also gained. EUROSTOXX 50 futures rose 0.8% early in Asia, while S&P 500 futures added 0.3% and Nasdaq futures increased 0.5%.翻译:欧洲和美国的股指期货也上涨。亚洲早盘，欧元斯托克 50 指数期货上涨 0.8%，标准普尔 500 指数期货上涨 0.3%，纳斯达克期货上涨 0.5%。

Overnight, the Fed held the policy rate steady in its current 5.25%-5.50% range. While Chair Jerome Powell did not rule out another hike, markets judged he was not quite as hawkish as he might have been.翻译:隔夜，美联储将政策利率维持在目前的 5.25%-5.50% 区间。尽管主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔不排除再次加息的可能性，但市场判断他并不像他应有的那么鹰派。

Fed funds futures rallied as markets pared back the risk of a December hike to about 22% and a January move to 28%. Markets have priced in a 70% chance that the tightening is over and rate cuts could amount to 85 basis points next year, beginning as soon as June.翻译:随着市场将 12 月加息风险降至 22% 左右，1 月加息风险降至 28%，联邦基金期货上涨。市场已经消化了紧缩政策结束的可能性为 70%，明年降息幅度可能达到 85 个基点，最快从 6 月份开始。

Wall Street and Treasuries rallied. The S&P 500 (.SPX) gained 1% and the Nasdaq Composite (.IXIC) surged 1.6%.翻译:华尔街和国债上涨。标准普尔 500 指数(.SPX)上涨 1%，纳斯达克综合指数(.IXIC)飙升 1.6%。

The benchmark 10-year Treasury yield eased another 2 basis points to 4.7089%, the lowest in more than two weeks. Overnight, it tumbled 14 basis points, the biggest daily drop since March, also in part due to a Treasury announcement that said the government will slow increases in the size of its longer-dated auctions.翻译:基准10年期国债收益率再下跌2个基点至4.7089%，为两周多以来最低。一夜之间，它下跌了 14 个基点，这是自 3 月份以来的最大单日跌幅，部分原因是财政部宣布政府将放慢长期拍卖规模的增长。

"While growth was incredibly strong in the third quarter of 2024 at 5%, we suspect a substantial slowing in 4Q24, which, based on Powell's remarks today, likely won't be enough to garner additional tightening," Tiffany Wilding, an economist at PIMCO, wrote in a note to clients.翻译:“虽然 2024 年第三季度经济增长令人难以置信地强劲，达到 5%，但我们怀疑 24 年第四季度经济增速将大幅放缓，根据鲍威尔今天的讲话，这可能不足以导致进一步紧缩，” PIMCO在给客户的一份报告中写道。

"Instead the FOMC is happy to remain on hold, and watch and see how the economy evolves early next year."翻译:“相反，联邦公开市场委员会很乐意继续按兵不动，并观察明年初经济如何发展。”

The next big focal point for the market is the non-farm payrolls data on Friday, which analysts expect to show the economy added 180,000 jobs in October, slowing from 336,000 increase the previous month. It will come after private payrolls increased far less than expected.翻译:市场的下一个焦点是周五的非农就业数据，分析师预计该数据将显示 10 月份经济新增 18 万个就业岗位，较上月的 33.6 万个就业岗位增幅有所放缓。它将发生在私人就业人数增幅远低于预期之后。

The dollar was again on the back foot on Thursday, falling 0.1% against its peers. The prospect that the Fed is done tightening buoyed risk sensitive currencies the most, with Australian dollar bouncing 0.6% to a three-week high of $0.6428.翻译:周四美元再次陷入困境，兑其他货币下跌 0.1%。美联储完成紧缩政策的前景对风险敏感货币的提振最大，澳元兑美元上涨 0.6%，至三周高点 0.6428 美元。

"Although the FOMC may not be talking about it today, within a few months, the question will no longer be 'Will they hike again?' but 'When will they cut?'," said Seema Shah, Chief Global Strategist at Principal Asset Management.翻译:“尽管联邦公开市场委员会今天可能不会谈论这个问题，但几个月后，问题将不再是‘他们会再次加息吗？’但‘他们什么时候会降息？’”信安资产管理公司首席全球策略师 Seema Shah 说道。

The yen continued to regain ground - up 0.3% to 150.46 per dollar on Thursday. It had hit a one-year low after a Bank of Japan decision to ease its control over the 1% cap on 10-year yields, with the tweak seen insufficient to close the wide interest rate gaps between Japan and other countries.翻译:周四，日元继续收复失地，上涨 0.3%，至 1 美元兑 150.46 日元。日本央行决定放宽对 10 年期国债收益率 1% 上限的控制，这一调整似乎不足以缩小日本与其他国家之间的巨大利差，导致该利率跌至一年低点。

Oil prices traded higher as the conflict in the Middle East kept investors on edge about whether it could disrupt oil supplies. Brent crude futures climbed 1.2% to $85.61 a barrel while U.S. West Texas Intermediate futures were at $81.43 a barrel, up 1.2%.翻译:由于中东冲突让投资者担心它是否会扰乱石油供应，油价走高。布伦特原油期货上涨 1.2%，至每桶 85.61 美元，而美国西德克萨斯中质原油期货上涨 1.2%，至每桶 81.43 美元。

The price of gold was 0.2% higher at $1,985.86 per ounce.翻译:金价上涨 0.2%，至每盎司 1,985.86 美元。

Reporting by Stella Qiu; Editing by Edwina Gibbs翻译:邱斯特拉报道；编辑：埃德温娜·吉布斯

item.title: 气候的“第二十二条军规”：减少污染使地球升温
item.description:
Air pollution, a global scourge that kills millions of people a year, is shielding us from the full force of the sun. Getting rid of it will accelerate climate change.翻译:空气污染是一种全球性的祸害，每年导致数百万人死亡，它使我们免受阳光的全部伤害。摆脱它会加速气候变化。

That's the unpalatable conclusion reached by scientists poring over the results of China's decade-long and highly effective "war on pollution", according to six leading climate experts.翻译:六位顶尖气候专家表示，这是科学家在研究中国长达十年且卓有成效的“污染战”成果后得出的令人不快的结论。

The drive to banish pollution, caused mainly by sulphur dioxide (SO2) spewed from coal plants, has cut SO2 emissions by close to 90% and saved hundreds of thousands of lives, Chinese official data and health studies show.翻译:中国官方数据和健康研究显示，消除主要由燃煤电厂排放的二氧化硫 (SO2) 造成的污染的努力已将二氧化硫排放量减少了近 90%，并挽救了数十万人的生命。

Yet stripped of its toxic shield, which scatters and reflects solar radiation, China's average temperatures have gone up by 0.7 degrees Celsius since 2014, triggering fiercer heatwaves, according to a Reuters review of meteorological data and the scientists interviewed.翻译:然而，根据路透社对气象数据和接受采访的科学家的评论，自从2014年以来，中国的平均气温已经上升了0.7摄氏度，引发了更猛烈的热浪。

"It's this Catch-22," said Patricia Quinn, an atmospheric chemist at the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), speaking about cleaning up sulphur pollution globally. "We want to clean up our air for air quality purposes but, by doing that, we're increasing warming."翻译:“这就是第二十二条军规，”美国国家海洋和大气管理局 (NOAA) 的大气化学家帕特里夏·奎恩 (Patricia Quinn) 在谈到清理全球硫污染时说道。 “我们希望净化空气以提高空气质量，但这样做只会加剧气候变暖。”

The removal of the air pollution - a term scientists call "unmasking" - may have had a greater effect on temperatures in some industrial Chinese cities over the last decade than the warming from greenhouse gases themselves, the scientists said.翻译:科学家们表示，过去十年，空气污染的消除——科学家称之为“揭露”——对中国一些工业城市气温的影响可能比温室气体本身造成的变暖更大。

Other highly polluted parts of the world, such as India and the Middle East, would see similar jumps in warming if they follow China's lead in cleaning the skies of sulphur dioxide and the polluting aerosols it forms, the experts warned.翻译:专家警告说，印度和中东等世界其他污染严重的地区如果效仿中国的做法，清除天空中的二氧化硫及其形成的污染性气溶胶，也会出现类似的变暖现象。

They said efforts to improve air quality could actually push the world into catastrophic warming scenarios and irreversible impacts.翻译:他们表示，改善空气质量的努力实际上可能会将世界推向灾难性的变暖情景和不可逆转的影响。

"Aerosols are masking one-third of the heating of the planet," said Paulo Artaxo, an environmental physicist and lead author of the chapter on short-lived climate pollutants in the most recent round of reports by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), completed this year.翻译:“气溶胶掩盖了地球三分之一的热量，”环境物理学家、政府间气候变化专门委员会 (IPCC) 最近一轮报告中短期气候污染物一章的主要作者保罗·阿塔索 (Paulo Artaxo) 说。 ），今年完成。

"If you implement technologies to reduce air pollution, this will accelerate – very significantly – global warming in the short term."翻译:“如果采用减少空气污染的技术，短期内将会非常显着地加速全球变暖。”

The Chinese and Indian environment ministries didn't immediately respond to requests for comment on the effects of pollution unmasking.翻译:中国和印度环境部没有立即回应就污染暴露的影响发表评论的请求。

The link between reducing sulphur dioxide and warming was flagged by the IPCC in a 2021 report which concluded that, without the solar shield of SO2 pollution, the global average temperature would already have risen by 1.6 degrees Celsius above preindustrial levels.翻译:IPCC 在2021 年的一份报告中指出了减少二氧化硫与变暖之间的联系，该报告得出的结论是，如果没有二氧化硫污染的遮阳罩，全球平均气温将比工业化前水平上升 1.6 摄氏度。

That misses the world's goal of limiting warming to 1.5C, beyond which scientists predict irreversible and catastrophic changes to the climate, according to the IPCC, which pegs the current level at 1.1C.翻译:这没有达到将升温限制在 1.5 摄氏度的世界目标，根据 IPCC 的说法，科学家预测，如果超过这个目标，气候将发生不可逆转的灾难性变化，目前的升温水平将控制在 1.1 摄氏度。

The Reuters review of the Chinese data provides the most detailed picture yet of how this phenomenon is playing out in the real world, drawing on previously unreported numbers on changes in temperatures and SO2 emissions over the past decade and corroborated by environmental scientists.翻译:路透社对中国数据的审查提供了迄今为止这一现象在现实世界中如何发生的最详细的图景，该数据利用了过去十年中温度和二氧化硫排放量变化的先前未报告的数据，并得到了环境科学家的证实。

Reuters interviewed 12 scientists in total on the phenomenon of unmasking globally, including four who have acted as authors or reviewers of sections on air pollution in IPCC reports.翻译:路透社就全球揭秘现象总共采访了12位科学家，其中4位曾担任IPCC报告中空气污染部分的作者或审稿人。

They said there was no suggestion among climate experts that the world should let-up on fighting air pollution, a clear and present danger that the World Health Organization says causes about 7 million premature deaths a year, mostly in poorer countries.翻译:他们表示，气候专家并没有建议世界应该放松对抗空气污染的力度，世界卫生组织表示，空气污染是一种明显而现实的危险，每年导致约 700 万人过早死亡，其中大多数是在较贫穷的国家。

Instead they stressed the need for more aggressive action to cut emissions of climate-warming greenhouse gases, with reducing methane seen as one of the most promising paths to offset pollution unmasking in the short term.翻译:相反，他们强调需要采取更积极的行动来减少导致气候变暖的温室气体的排放，减少甲烷被视为短期内抵消污染的最有希望的途径之一。

XI BATTLES 'AIRPOCALYPSE'

President Xi Jinping pledged to tackle pollution when he took power in 2012 following decades of coal-burning that had helped turn China into "the factory of the world". The following year, as record smog in Beijing inspired "Airpocalypse" newspaper headlines, the government unveiled what scientists called China's version of the U.S. Clean Air Act.翻译:几十年来煤炭燃烧使中国成为“世界工厂”，习近平主席在 2012 年上台时承诺解决污染问题。第二年，随着北京创纪录的雾霾成为报纸头条“空气末日”的头条，政府公布了科学家称之为中国版的美国清洁空气法案。

On March 5, 2014, a week after Xi went on a walkabout during another extreme bout of smog in the capital, the government officially declared a war on pollution at the National People's Congress.翻译:2014年3月5日，习近平在首都另一场严重雾霾天气中巡视一周后，政府在全国人民代表大会上正式向污染宣战。

Under the new rules, power plants and steel mills were forced to switch to lower-sulphur coal. Hundreds of inefficient factories were shuttered, and vehicle fuel standards toughened up. While coal continues to be China's largest power source, smokestack scrubbers now strip out most SO2 emissions.翻译:根据新规定，发电厂和钢厂被迫改用低硫煤炭。数百家效率低下的工厂被关闭，汽车燃料标准也更加严格。虽然煤炭仍然是中国最大的能源，但烟囱洗涤器现在消除了大部分二氧化硫排放。

China's SO2 emissions had decreased from a 2006 peak of at nearly 26 million metric tons to 20.4 million tons in 2013 thanks to more gradual emissions restrictions. But with the war on pollution, those emissions had plummeted by about 87% to 2.7 million metric tons by 2021.翻译:由于更加渐进的排放限制，中国的二氧化硫排放量已从 2006 年近 2600 万吨的峰值下降到 2013 年的 2040 万吨。但随着对污染的战争，到 2021 年，这些排放量已大幅下降约 87%，至 270 万吨。

The drop in pollution was accompanied by a leap in warming - the nine years since 2014 have seen national average annual temperatures in China of 10.34C, up more than 0.7C compared with the 2001-2010 period, according to Reuters calculations based on yearly weather reports published by the China Meteorological Administration.翻译:污染的下降伴随着气温的急剧上升——据路透社根据每年的天气情况计算，自2014年以来的9年里，中国全国年平均气温为10.34摄氏度，比2001年至2010年期间上升了0.7摄氏度以上。中国气象局发布的报告。

Scientific estimates vary as to how much of that rise comes from unmasking versus greenhouse gas emissions or natural climate variations like El Nino.翻译:对于这一上升有多少是由于温室气体排放或厄尔尼诺等自然气候变化造成的，科学估计各不相同。

The impacts are more acute at a local level near the pollution source. Almost immediately, China saw big warming jumps from its unmasking of pollution near heavy industrial regions, according to climate scientist Yangyang Xu at Texas A&M University, who models the impact of aerosols on the climate.翻译:在靠近污染源的地方，影响更为严重。德克萨斯农工大学的气候科学家杨阳徐对气溶胶对气候的影响进行了模拟，他表示，由于揭露了重工业区附近的污染，中国几乎立即就看到了气温大幅上升。

Xu told Reuters he estimated that unmasking had caused temperatures near the cities of Chongqing and Wuhan, long known as China's "furnaces", to rise by almost 1C since sulphur emissions peaked in the mid-2000s.翻译:徐告诉路透社，他估计，自2000年代中期硫排放量达到峰值以来，揭开口罩导致长期以来被称为中国“火炉”的重庆和武汉附近的气温上升了近1摄氏度。

During heatwaves, the unmasking effect can be even more pronounced. Laura Wilcox, a climate scientist who studies the effects of aerosols at Britain's University of Reading, said a computer simulation showed that the rapid decline in SO2 in China could raise temperatures on extreme-heat days by as much as 2C.翻译:在热浪期间，暴露效应可能更加明显。英国雷丁大学研究气溶胶影响的气候科学家劳拉·威尔科克斯(Laura Wilcox)表示，计算机模拟显示，中国二氧化硫浓度的迅速下降可能会使极端炎热天气的气温升高多达2摄氏度。

"Those are big differences, especially for somewhere like China, where heat is already pretty dangerous," she said.翻译:“这些差异很大，特别是对于中国这样的地方来说，那里的高温已经相当危险了，”她说。

Indeed, heatwaves in China have been particularly ferocious this year. A town in the northwestern region of Xinjiang saw temperatures of 52.2C (126F) in July, shattering the national temperature record of 50.3C set in 2015.翻译:事实上，今年中国的热浪尤其猛烈。新疆西北部地区的一个城镇 7 月份的气温达到 52.2 摄氏度（126 华氏度），打破了 2015 年创下的 50.3 摄氏度的全国气温记录。

Beijing also experienced a record heatwave, with temperatures topping 35C (95F) for more than four weeks.翻译:北京也经历了创纪录的热浪，气温超过 35 摄氏度（95 华氏度）长达四个星期多。

INDIA AND MIDDLE EAST

The effects of sulphur unmasking are most pronounced in developing countries, as the U.S. and most of Europe cleaned up their skies decades ago. While the heat rise from sulphur cleanup is strongest locally, the effects can be felt in far-distant regions. One 2021 study co-authored by Xu found that a decrease in European aerosol emissions since the 1980s may have shifted weather patterns in Northern China.翻译:硫磺暴露的影响在发展中国家最为明显，美国和大部分欧洲国家几十年前就清理了天空。虽然硫磺清除产生的热量在当地最强，但在遥远的地区也能感受到影响。 Xu 与人共同撰写的一项 2021 年研究发现，自 20 世纪 80 年代以来欧洲气溶胶排放量的减少可能改变了中国北方的天气模式。

In India, sulphur pollution is still rising, roughly doubling in the last two decades, according to calculations by NOAA researchers based on figures from the U.S.-funded Community Emissions Data System.翻译:根据美国国家海洋和大气管理局研究人员根据美国资助的社区排放数据系统的数据计算，在印度，硫污染仍在上升，在过去二十年中大约翻了一番。

In 2020, when that pollution plummeted due to COVID lockdowns, ground temperatures in India were the eighth warmest on record, 0.29 C higher than the 1981-2010 average, despite the cooling effects of the La Nina climate pattern, according to the India Meteorological Department.翻译:据印度气象部门称，2020年，尽管拉尼娜气候模式产生了降温作用，但由于新冠疫情封锁，污染大幅下降，印度的地面温度仍处于有记录以来第八高的水平，比1981年至2010年的平均温度高出0.29摄氏度。

India aims for an air cleanup like China's, and in 2019 launched its National Clean Air Programme to reduce pollution by 40% in more than 100 cities by 2026.翻译:印度的目标是像中国一样净化空气，并于 2019 年启动了国家清洁空气计划，到 2026 年将 100 多个城市的污染减少 40%。

Once polluted regions in India or the Middle East improve their air quality by abandoning fossil fuels and transitioning to green energy sources, they too will lose their shield of sulphates, scientists said.翻译:科学家表示，一旦印度或中东的污染地区通过放弃化石燃料并转向绿色能源来改善空气质量，它们也将失去硫酸盐的保护。

"You stop your anthropogenic activities for a brief moment of time and the atmosphere cleans up very, very quickly and the temperatures jump instantaneously," added Sergey Osipov, a climate modeller at the King Abdullah University of Science and Technology in Saudi Arabia.翻译:沙特阿拉伯阿卜杜拉国王科技大学的气候模型师谢尔盖·奥西波夫补充道：“如果人类活动暂时停止，大气就会非常非常快地净化，气温也会瞬间上升。”

OFFSETTING WITH METHANE?

As the implications of the pollution unmasking become more apparent, experts are casting around for methods to counter the associated warming.翻译:随着污染暴露的影响变得越来越明显，专家们正在寻找应对相关变暖的方法。

One proposal called "solar radiation management" envisions deliberately injecting sulphur aerosols into the atmosphere to cool temperatures. But many scientists worry that the approach could unleash unintended consequences.翻译:一项名为“太阳辐射管理”的提案设想故意将硫气溶胶注入大气中以降低温度。但许多科学家担心这种方法可能会带来意想不到的后果。

A more mainstream plan is to curb methane emissions. This is seen as the quickest way to tame global temperatures because the effects of the gas in the atmosphere last only a decade or so, so cutting emissions now would deliver results within a decade. Carbon dioxide, by comparison, persists for centuries.翻译:更主流的计划是遏制甲烷排放。这被认为是控制全球气温的最快方法，因为大气中气体的影响仅持续十年左右，因此现在减少排放将在十年内取得成果。相比之下，二氧化碳可以持续存在几个世纪。

As of 2019, methane had caused about 0.5C in warming compared with preindustrial levels, according to IPCC figures.翻译:根据IPCC的数据，截至2019年，与工业化前水平相比，甲烷导致气温升高约0.5摄氏度。

While more than 100 countries have pledged to reduce methane emissions by 30% by the end of the decade, few have gone further than drawing up "action plans" and "pathways" to cuts. China - the world's biggest emitter - has yet to publish its plan.翻译:尽管已有 100 多个国家承诺到本世纪末将甲烷排放量减少 30%，但除了制定减排“行动计划”和“途径”之外，很少有国家采取了进一步行动。中国——世界上最大的排放国——尚未公布其计划。

By targeting methane, the world could mitigate the warming effect of the reduction in pollution and potentially avert catastrophic consequences, said Michael Diamond, an atmospheric scientist at Florida State University.翻译:佛罗里达州立大学大气科学家迈克尔·戴蒙德表示，通过瞄准甲烷，世界可以减轻污染减少带来的变暖效应，并有可能避免灾难性后果。

"This doesn't doom us to going above 1.5 degrees Celsius if we clean up the air."翻译:“如果我们净化空气，这并不意味着我们的气温会上升到 1.5 摄氏度以上。”

Reporting by Jake Spring in Sao Paulo and David Stanway in Singapore; Additional reporting by Sakshi Dayal in New Delhi; Editing by Katy Daigle and Pravin Char翻译:Jake Spring 在圣保罗和 David Stanway 在新加坡的报道； Sakshi Dayal 在新德里的补充报道；凯蒂·戴格尔和普拉文·查尔编辑

item.title: 中国前总理李克强火葬日降半旗致哀
item.description:
China ordered the lowering of the national flag at Tiananmen Square in the heart of the Chinese capital Beijing on Thursday, when the remains of former premier Li Keqiang are scheduled to be cremated, state media said.翻译:官方媒体称，周四，中国下令在中国首都北京市中心的天安门广场降下国旗，届时前总理李克强的遗体将被火化。

"In memory of comrade Li Keqiang, flags were flown at half-mast at Tiananmen Square in the capital," CCTV said in a report accompanied by a photo of the country's flag being lowered in front of the monumental gate, against the backdrop of a foggy grey morning.翻译:中央电视台在一篇报道中称，“为纪念李克强同志，首都天安门广场下半旗致哀”，并附上一张在纪念性大门前降下国旗的照片。有雾的灰色早晨。

The national flag will be flown at half mast across the country, the official Xinhua News Agency said on Tuesday, including at Beijing's Great Hall of the People, the foreign ministry as well as seats of local governments across the country, and diplomatic missions.翻译:官方新华社周二表示， 全国将下半旗志哀，包括在北京人民大会堂、外交部以及全国地方政府所在地和外交使团。

Li, a former economist and pro-reform leader who served as the premier for 10 years before retiring in March, died of a heart attack in Shanghai last Friday and his remains were transferred to the capital the same day.翻译:李克强是一位前经济学家、 支持改革的领导人，曾担任总理10年，今年3月退休。李克强上周五在上海因心脏病去世，他的遗体当天被转移到首都。

Reporting by Liz Lee and Shanghai newsroom; Editing by Christian Schmollinger翻译:Liz Lee和上海新闻编辑室的报道；克里斯蒂安·施莫林格编辑

item.title: 美联储按兵不动，美元追随国债收益率走低
item.description:
The dollar fell broadly on Thursday, tracking a slide in U.S. Treasury yields as markets grew more convinced the Federal Reserve was done with its aggressive monetary policy tightening cycle after it left rates unchanged.翻译:美元周四普遍下跌，追随美国国债收益率下滑，因为市场越来越相信美联储在维持利率不变后已经结束了激进的货币政策紧缩周期。

The Fed on Wednesday held interest rates steady as widely expected, as policymakers struggled to determine whether financial conditions may be sufficiently tight to control inflation.翻译:美联储周三如普遍预期一样维持利率稳定，因为政策制定者难以确定金融状况是否足以控制通胀。

However, Fed Chair Jerome Powell acknowledged that a recent market-driven rise in Treasury bond yields, home mortgage rates and other financing costs could have their own impact on the economy as long as they persist.翻译:然而，美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔承认，近期市场驱动的国债收益率、住房抵押贷款利率和其他融资成本的上升只要持续存在，就可能对经济产生影响。

The decision lifted sentiment in Wall Street, which spilled over into the Asia day, giving a small boost to the risk-sensitive Australian and New Zealand dollars.翻译:这一决定提振了华尔街的情绪，这种情绪一直蔓延到亚洲交易日，对风险敏感的澳元和新西兰元小幅提振。

The Aussie rose 0.5% to a three-week high of $0.6426, while the kiwi similarly jumped more than 0.5% to hit a two-week top of $0.58825.翻译:澳元兑美元上涨 0.5%，至三周高点 0.6426 美元，新西​​兰元同样上涨超过 0.5%，至两周高点 0.58825 美元。

The dollar edged broadly lower alongside U.S. Treasury yields which touched multi-week lows in early Asia trade.翻译:美元普遍走低，美国国债收益率在亚洲早盘触及数周低点。

"It seems to us that the FOMC is now in hold mode, albeit in a hawkish way, rather than simply on pause," said Wells Fargo chief economist Jay Bryson. "That is, we think the bar to further rate increases is higher now than it was a few months ago."翻译:富国银行首席经济学家杰伊·布赖森表示：“在我们看来，联邦公开市场委员会现在处于搁置模式，尽管是以鹰派的方式，而不是简单地暂停。” “也就是说，我们认为现在进一步加息的门槛比几个月前更高。”

The two-year U.S. Treasury yield , which typically reflects near-term interest rate expectations, slid to a nearly two-month low of 4.9250% on Thursday, while the benchmark 10-year yield fell to an over two-week low of 4.7070%.翻译:通常反映近期利率预期的两年期美国国债收益率周四跌至近两个月低点4.9250%，而基准10年期国债收益率跌至两周多低点4.7070% 。

Against the dollar, the euro rose 0.18% to $1.0589.翻译:欧元兑美元上涨0.18%至1.0589美元。

The U.S. dollar index fell 0.11% to 106.34.翻译:美元指数下跌0.11%至106.34。

Traders also drew further conviction that U.S. rates could have peaked after data showed U.S. manufacturing contracted sharply in October, though separate data pointed to a still-resilient labour market, which is likely to see the Fed keeping rates at restrictive levels for longer.翻译:数据显示美国制造业在 10 月份大幅收缩后，交易员还进一步确信美国利率可能已见顶，尽管单独的数据表明劳动力市场仍然具有弹性，美联储可能会在更长的时间内将利率维持在限制性水平。

"We will likely need to see some labour market weakness before target inflation is reached," said Lon Erickson, portfolio manager at Thornburg Investment Management.翻译:桑伯格投资管理公司投资组合经理朗·埃里克森表示：“在达到目标通胀之前，我们可能需要看到劳动力市场出现一些疲软。”

"This could take some time to develop and is one reason we are likely to see higher rates for longer."翻译:“这可能需要一些时间才能形成，也是我们可能会在更长时间内看到更高利率的原因之一。”

Market pricing shows a nearly 15% chance that the Fed could begin cutting rates as early as next March, according to the CME FedWatch tool, compared with a roughly 10% chance a week ago.翻译:根据 CME FedWatch 工具的数据，市场定价显示美联储最早在明年 3 月开始降息的可能性接近 15%，而一周前这一可能性约为 10%。

The move lower in the dollar brought some respite for the yen, though it remained on the weaker side of 150 per dollar.翻译:美元走低给日元带来了一些喘息的机会，但日元仍处于 1 美元兑 150 日元的弱势水平。

The Japanese currency last stood at 150.44 per dollar, having slid to a one-year low of 151.74 per dollar earlier in the week in the wake of the Bank of Japan's (BOJ) monetary policy decision.翻译:日元兑美元最新汇率为 150.44，本周早些时候，在日本央行 (BOJ) 货币政策决定公布后，日元兑美元跌至一年低点 151.74。

Investors were still struggling to digest the implications of the central bank's piecemeal tweak to its controversial bond yield control policy - a move that has sent Japan's bond market and currency reacting in divergence.翻译:投资者仍在努力消化日本央行对其有争议的债券收益率控制政策进行零碎调整的影响，这一举措已导致日本债券市场和货币反应出现分歧。

"This almost feels like the end of the line for YCC, but the extent to which the BOJ will intervene in the JGB market should 10-year yields rise above 1% is as yet unclear," said Tom Kenny, senior international economist at ANZ.翻译:澳新银行(ANZ)高级国际经济学家汤姆·肯尼(Tom Kenny)表示：“对于YCC来说，这几乎感觉已经结束了，但如果10年期国债收益率升至1%以上，日本央行将在多大程度上干预日本国债市场，目前尚不清楚。” 。

"We think the BOJ will be content to let longer duration yields move higher in an orderly manner and that intervention is likely to occur if moves are volatile."翻译:“我们认为日本央行将满足于让长期收益率有序走高，如果收益率波动较大，则可能会进行干预。”

Elsewhere, sterling rose 0.35% to $1.2192 ahead of the Bank of England's rate decision later on Thursday, where expectations are for the central bank to keep rates on hold.翻译:其他方面，在周四晚些时候英国央行做出利率决定之前，英镑上涨0.35%至1.2192美元， 预计央行将维持利率不变。

item.title: 可持续棉花组织加强对顶级零售商的追踪
item.description:
Swiss-based sustainability group Better Cotton said on Thursday it has added new functions to a platform that big retailers use to trace materials through their supply chains.翻译:总部位于瑞士的可持续发展组织 Better Cotton 周四表示，它已为大型零售商用来追踪供应链中材料的平台添加了新功能。

Better Cotton said retailers including Walmart (WMT.N) and Marks and Spencer (MKS.L) will be able to tell where cotton was grown and traded, eventually to the level of individual farms. Currently the platform tracks only the total volume of cotton produced.翻译:Better Cotton表示，包括沃尔玛（WMT.N）和玛莎百货（MKS.L）在内的零售商将能够了解棉花的种植和交易地点，最终达到各个农场的水平。目前该平台仅跟踪棉花生产总量。

Jacky Broomhead, Better Cotton senior manager, said the current functionality is much like an electrical customer who knows the sources of generation feeding their local grid, but not to individual houses. "The changes mean you'll you know what you're getting. You'll be able to see the journey the cotton has taken to you as a retailer," she said.翻译:良好棉花高级经理 Jacky Broomhead 表示，当前的功能很像电力客户，他们知道当地电网的发电来源，但不知道各个家庭的发电来源。 “这些变化意味着你会知道你得到了什么。你将能够看到棉花给你作为零售商带来的旅程，”她说。

Created by companies and several nonprofits including the World Wildlife Fund, Better Cotton aims to support improved practices in areas like water and soil stewardship and to promote better working standards. It says it supports 2.2 million farmers globally, accounting for 22% of world cotton production.翻译:更好的棉花由公司和包括世界自然基金会在内的多个非营利组织创建，旨在支持改进水和土壤管理等领域的做法，并促进更好的工作标准。该公司表示，它为全球 220 万农民提供支持，占世界棉花产量的 22%。

Fashion retailers face pressures from consumers and activist groups to sell products with less environmental impact and made in safe labor conditions.翻译:时装零售商面临着来自消费者和激进团体的压力，要求其销售对环境影响较小且在安全劳动条件下生产的产品。

Better Cotton has suspended its licensing of cotton sourced from the Chinese province of Xinjiang. At the time it cited factors including human-rights concerns and audit difficulties. Western retailers have faced backlash for raising human-rights issues.翻译:良好棉花公司已暂停对来自中国新疆省的棉花发放许可证。当时它列举了包括人权问题和审计困难在内的因素。西方零售商因提出人权问题而面临强烈反对。

Participants in the supply chain for cotton include spinners, traders and manufacturers. Marks and Spencer's head of materials and sustainability, Katharine Beacham, said it will use the new functionality to track cotton at scale.翻译:棉花供应链的参与者包括纺纱厂、贸易商和制造商。马莎百货 (Marks and Spencer) 材料和可持续发展主管凯瑟琳·比彻姆 (Katharine Beacham) 表示，将使用新功能大规模追踪棉花。

"By improving the traceability of our cotton further down the supply chain, we're able to work with our suppliers more closely," she said.翻译:“通过提高供应链下游棉花的可追溯性，我们能够与供应商更密切地合作，”她说。

Reporting by Ross Kerber in Boston Editing by Matthew Lewis翻译:罗斯·科伯 (Ross Kerber) 波士顿报道 马修·刘易斯 (Matthew Lewis) 编辑

item.title: 布林肯和奥斯汀将于 11 月与印度同行讨论印度太平洋问题
item.description:
U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin will meet with their Indian counterparts later this month in New Delhi to discuss "concerns and developments in the Indo-Pacific", the State Department said on Wednesday.翻译:美国国务院周三表示，美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯和国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀将于本月晚些时候在新德里会见印度外长，讨论“印太地区的担忧和事态发展”。

The meeting with India's foreign minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar and the country's defense minister Rajnath Singh comes amid tensions between the United States and China in the Indo-Pacific region.翻译:与印度外交部长苏杰生和国防部长拉杰纳特·辛格的会面正值美国和中国在印太地区的紧张局势之际。

item.title: 中国同意与美国进行核军控谈判 - 华尔街日报
item.description:
China and the United States will discuss nuclear arms control next week, the first such talks since the Obama administration, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.翻译:据《华尔街日报》周三报道，中国和美国将于下周讨论核军控问题，这是自奥巴马政府以来的首次此类会谈。

China's Foreign Ministry said on Monday after a visit by Foreign Minister Wang Yi to Washington that the two countries would hold "consultations on arms control and non-proliferation" in the coming days, as well as separate talks on maritime affairs and other issues.翻译:中国外交部周一在外交部长王毅访问华盛顿后表示，两国将在未来几天举行“军控和防扩散磋商”，并就海洋事务和其他问题举行单独会谈。

Those arms talks would be led on Monday by Mallory Stewart, a senior State Department official, and Sun Xiaobo, the head of the arms-control department at China's Foreign Ministry, the Wall Street Journal report said.翻译:据《华尔街日报》报道，这些军备谈判将于周一由国务院高级官员马洛里·斯图尔特和中国外交部军控司司长孙晓波主持。

The U.S. State Department and China's embassy in Washington did not immediately respond to requests by Reuters for comment on the timing or format of the talks.翻译:美国国务院和中国驻华盛顿大使馆没有立即回应路透社就会谈时间或形式发表评论的请求。

U.S. National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said in 2021 that the Chinese and U.S. presidents had agreed to "look to begin to carry forward discussion on strategic stability", a reference to Washington's concerns about Beijing's nuclear weapons build-up.翻译:美国国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文 (Jake Sullivan) 于 2021 年表示，中美两国总统已同意“寻求开始推进有关战略稳定的讨论”，这指的是华盛顿对北京核武器集结的担忧。

But the White House was quick to say at the time that the discussions would not resemble formal arms reduction talks, like those the U.S. has had with Russia.翻译:但白宫当时很快表示，此次讨论与美国与俄罗斯进行的正式削减军备谈判不同。

Since then, U.S. officials had expressed frustration that China showed little interest in discussing steps to reduce nuclear weapons risks.翻译:此后，美国官员对中国对讨论降低核武器风险的措施兴趣不大表示失望。

China has more than 500 operational nuclear warheads in its arsenal and will probably have over 1,000 warheads by 2030, the Pentagon said in October. But Beijing has long argued that the U.S. already has a much larger arsenal. The arms talks would occur before a likely meeting between U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping in San Francisco in November, although a senior Biden administration official said on Tuesday important details have yet to be hammered out.翻译:五角大楼去年 10 月表示，中国的武库中拥有超过 500 枚可使用的核弹头， 到 2030 年可能会拥有超过 1,000 枚核弹头。但北京长期以来一直认为美国已经拥有更大的核武库。军备谈判将在美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平可能于 11 月在旧金山举行会议之前进行，不过拜登政府高级官员周二表示，重要细节尚未敲定。

A flurry of China-U.S. diplomatic engagements in recent months, largely at Washington's request, has sought to salvage what were rapidly deteriorating ties between the two countries following the U.S. downing in February of a suspected Chinese spy balloon over the United States.翻译:近几个月来，中美两国在很大程度上应华盛顿的要求进行了一系列外交接触，试图挽救自美国二月份击落美国上空疑似中国间谍气球以来迅速恶化的两国关系。

Daryl Kimball, executive director of the Washington-based Arms Control Association, said the overdue arms talks would likely focus on promoting greater transparency of each countries' nuclear doctrines and more effective crisis-communication channels.翻译:总部位于华盛顿的军备控制协会执行董事达里尔·金博尔表示，迟来的军备谈判可能会集中于提高各国核理论的透明度和更有效的危机沟通渠道。

"I don't think, however, we should expect breakthroughs in the near term. That's going to take time and give and take from both sides," Kimball said.翻译:“然而，我认为我们不应期望在短期内取得突破。这需要时间，需要双方的妥协，”金博尔说。

Reporting by Jasper Ward, Dan Whitcomb, Michael Martina and David Brunnstrom; Editing by Sandra Maler and Grant McCool翻译:Jasper Ward、Dan Whitcomb、Michael Martina 和 David Brunnstrom 报道；桑德拉·马勒和格兰特·麦库尔编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 人工智能安全峰会：中美欧同意共同努力
item.description:
Summary:
  • China signals willingness to cooperate翻译:中国释放合作意愿
  • AI Safety Summit being held at Bletchley Park翻译:人工智能安全峰会在布莱切利公园举行
  • Tech execs and political leaders discuss risks翻译:科技高管和政治领导人讨论风险

China agreed to work with the United States, European Union and other countries to collectively manage the risk from artificial intelligence at a British summit on Wednesday aimed at charting a safe way forward for the rapidly evolving technology.翻译:在周三举行的英国峰会上，中国同意与美国、欧盟和其他国家合作，共同管理人工智能带来的风险，旨在为这项快速发展的技术制定安全的前进道路。

Some tech executives and political leaders have warned the rapid development of AI poses an existential threat to the world if not controlled, sparking a race by governments and international institutions to design safeguards and regulation.翻译:一些科技高管和政治领导人警告说，人工智能的快速发展如果不加以控制，将对世界构成生存威胁，从而引发各国政府和国际机构竞相设计保障措施和监管。

In a first for Western efforts to manage its safe development, a Chinese vice minister joined U.S. and EU leaders and tech bosses such as Elon Musk and ChatGPT's Sam Altman at Bletchley Park, home of Britain's World War Two code-breakers.翻译:中国副部长与埃隆·马斯克（Elon Musk）和 ChatGPT 的山姆·奥尔特曼（Sam Altman）等美国和欧盟领导人以及科技巨头一起来到布莱切利公园（英国第二次世界大战密码破译者的故乡），这是西方管理其安全发展的首次努力。

More than 25 countries present, including the United States and China, as well as the EU, signed a "Bletchley Declaration" saying countries needed to work together and establish a common approach on oversight.翻译:包括美国、中国以及欧盟在内的超过 25 个国家与会签署了《布莱切利宣言》 ，表示各国需要共同努力，建立共同的监督方法。

The declaration set out a two-pronged agenda focused on identifying risks of shared concern and building scientific understanding of them, while also developing cross-country policies to mitigate them.翻译:该宣言提出了双管齐下的议程，重点是确定共同关注的风险并建立对这些风险的科学理解，同时制定跨国政策来缓解这些风险。

Wu Zhaohui, China's vice minister of science and technology, told the opening session of the two-day summit that Beijing was ready to increase collaboration on AI safety to help build an international "governance framework".翻译:中国科技部副部长吴朝晖在为期两天的峰会开幕式上表示，北京准备加强人工智能安全方面的合作，以帮助建立国际“治理框架”。

"Countries regardless of their size and scale have equal rights to develop and use AI," he said.翻译:“国家无论大小，都拥有平等的开发和使用人工智能的权利，”他说。

Fears about the impact AI could have on economies and society took off in November last year when Microsoft-backed (MSFT.O) OpenAI made ChatGPT available to the public.翻译:去年 11 月，当微软支持的OpenAI 向公众开放 ChatGPT 时，人们开始担心人工智能可能对经济和社会产生的影响。

Using natural language processing tools to create human-like dialogue, it has stoked fears, including among some AI pioneers, that machines could in time achieve greater intelligence than humans, leading to unlimited, unintended consequences.翻译:使用自然语言处理工具来创建类似人类的对话，引起了包括一些人工智能先驱者在内的担忧，即机器最终可能会获得比人类更高的智能，从而导致无限的、意想不到的后果。

Governments and officials are now trying to chart a way forward alongside AI companies which fear being weighed down by regulation before the technology reaches its full potential.翻译:政府和官员现在正试图与人工智能公司一起制定前进的道路，这些公司担心在该技术充分发挥潜力之前会受到监管的压力。

"I don't know what necessarily the fair rules are, but you've got to start with insight before you do oversight," the billionaire Musk told reporters, adding that a "third-party referee" could be used to sound the alarm when risks develop.翻译:亿万富翁马斯克告诉记者：“我不知道公平的规则到底是什么，但在进行监督之前，你必须从洞察力开始。”他补充说，可以使用“第三方裁判”来敲响警钟。当风险出现时。

While the European Union has focused its AI oversight on data privacy and surveillance and their potential impact on human rights, the British summit is looking at so-called existential risks from highly capable general-purpose models called "frontier AI".翻译:虽然欧盟将人工智能监管的重点放在数据隐私和监视及其对人权的潜在影响上，但英国峰会正在研究被称为“前沿人工智能”的高性能通用模型带来的所谓存在风险。

Mustafa Suleyman, the cofounder of Google Deepmind, told reporters he did not think current AI frontier models posed any "significant catastrophic harms" but said it made sense to plan ahead as the industry trains ever larger models.翻译:谷歌 Deepmind 联合创始人穆斯塔法·苏莱曼 (Mustafa Suleyman) 告诉记者，他认为当前的人工智能前沿模型不会造成任何“重大灾难性危害”，但他表示，随着行业训练更大的模型，提前计划是有意义的。

CODE-BREAKER VENUE

The summit is the brainchild of British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, who wants to carve out a post-Brexit role for his country as an intermediary between the economic blocs of the United States, China and the EU.翻译:这次峰会是英国首相里希·苏纳克(Rishi Sunak)的创意，他希望在脱欧后为英国塑造一个美国、中国和欧盟经济集团之间的中间人的角色。

British digital minister Michelle Donelan said it was an achievement just to get so many key players in one room. She announced two further AI Safety Summits, one to be held in South Korea in six months and another in France six months after that.翻译:英国数字部长米歇尔·多尼兰 (Michelle Donelan) 表示，能在一个房间里聚集这么多关键人物就已经是一项成就了。她宣布再召开两场人工智能安全峰会，一场将于六个月后在韩国举行，另一场将于六个月后在法国举行。

"For the first time, we now have countries agreeing that we need to look not just independently but collectively at the risk around frontier AI," Donelan told reporters.翻译:多尼兰对记者表示：“现在各国首次同意，我们不仅需要独立地关注，而且需要共同关注前沿人工智能的风险。”

Just as tech companies compete for dominance in AI, governments are jostling to lead the way on regulation.翻译:正如科技公司争夺人工智能领域的主导地位一样，各国政府也在争先恐后地在监管方面发挥带头作用。

China is a key participant at the summit, given the country's role in developing AI. But some British lawmakers have questioned whether it should be there given the low level of trust between Beijing, Washington and many European capitals when it comes to Chinese involvement in technology.翻译:鉴于中国在发展人工智能方面的作用，中国是峰会的主要参与者。但一些英国议员质疑，鉴于北京、华盛顿和许多欧洲国家首都之间在中国参与科技方面的信任度较低，该机构是否应该存在。

The United States made clear on the eve of the summit that the call to Beijing had very much come from Britain, with its Ambassador to London, Jane Hartley, telling Reuters: "This is the UK invitation, this is not the U.S."翻译:美国在峰会前夕明确表示，对北京的邀请很大程度上来自英国，其驻伦敦大使简·哈特利(Jane Hartley)告诉路透社：“这是英国的邀请，不是美国”

U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris's decision to give a speech in London on Wednesday about her government's response to AI, and hold some meetings with attendees away from the summit, meaning they may have to leave early, also raised some eyebrows.翻译:美国副总统卡马拉·哈里斯决定周三在伦敦就政府对人工智能的反应发表演讲，并在峰会之外与与会者举行一些会议，这意味着他们可能不得不提前离开，这也引起了一些人的关注。

Sachin Dev Duggal, founder of London-based AI firm Builder.ai said it risked undermining the event's core focus, while some lawmakers from Sunak's Conservative Party suggested Washington was trying to overshadow his summit.翻译:总部位于伦敦的人工智能公司 Builder.ai 的创始人 Sachin Dev Duggal 表示，这可能会破坏此次活动的核心焦点，而苏纳克保守党的一些议员则表示，华盛顿正试图给他的峰会蒙上阴影。

British officials denied that, saying they wanted as many voices as possible.翻译:英国官员否认了这一点，称他们希望有尽可能多的声音。

Just days after U.S. President Joe Biden signed an executive order on AI, his government used the British summit to announce it would launch a U.S. AI Safety Institute.翻译:就在美国总统乔·拜登签署人工智能行政命令几天后，美国政府利用英国峰会宣布将成立美国人工智能安全研究所。

Harris will meet Sunak later on Wednesday, including for dinner, and attend the summit's second day on Thursday.翻译:哈里斯将于周三晚些时候与苏纳克会面，包括共进晚餐，并于周四参加第二天的峰会。

item.title: 高通因中国实力超出预期，股价上涨
item.description:
Chip designer Qualcomm (QCOM.O) forecast first-quarter sales and profits above Wall Street targets on Wednesday as a smartphone sales slump finally starts to ease, especially in China, and a renewed contract with Apple (AAPL.O) helps boost its outlook.翻译:芯片设计商高通(QCOM.O)周三预测第一季度销售额和利润将高于华尔街目标，因为智能手机销量下滑终于开始缓解，尤其是在中国，而与苹果(AAPL.O)续签合同有助于提振其前景。

The San Diego, California-based company forecast current-quarter revenue of $9.1 billion to $9.9 billion, with a midpoint above analysts' expectations of $9.2 billion according to LSEG data. Qualcomm predicted current-quarter adjusted profits of $2.25 to $2.45 per share, beating expectations of $2.23 according to LSEG.翻译:根据 LSEG 的数据，这家总部位于加利福尼亚州圣地亚哥的公司预计本季度营收为 91 亿美元至 99 亿美元，高于分析师预期的 92 亿美元。高通预计本季度调整后每股利润为 2.25 美元至 2.45 美元，超出 LSEG 的预期 2.23 美元。

Qualcomm shares rose 3.4% after the results were released.翻译:财报公布后，高通股价上涨 3.4%。

On a conference call, Qualcomm Chief Executive Cristiano Amon told investors smartphone companies had finally worked through most of their existing inventory and were starting to put in fresh orders.翻译:高通首席执行官克里斯蒂亚诺·阿蒙在电话会议上告诉投资者，智能手机公司终于耗尽了大部分现有库存，并开始下新订单。

"We're happy that the inventory dynamics that we have seen within the Android business are largely behind us right now," Amon said.翻译:“我们很高兴 Android 业务中的库存动态现在基本上已经过去了，”阿蒙说。

For the just-ended fiscal fourth quarter, Qualcomm reported sales of $8.67 billion and adjusted profits of $2.02 per share, both above analysts' estimates of $8.51 billion and $1.91 per share, according to LSEG data.翻译:根据 LSEG 的数据，在刚刚结束的第四财季，高通的销售额为 86.7 亿美元，调整后利润为每股 2.02 美元，均高于分析师预期的 85.1 亿美元和每股 1.91 美元。

Qualcomm is facing new competition from Huawei Technologies (HWT.UL), which has resumed producing its own smartphone chips after relying on the U.S. company for the past several years.翻译:高通正面临来自华为技术公司（HWT.UL）的新竞争，该公司在过去几年依赖这家美国公司后已恢复生产自己的智能手机芯片。

Amon said he does not expect Huawei's re-entry into the market to affect its relationship with Chinese smartphone companies, and Chief Financial Officer Akash Palkhiwala estimated a 35% quarter-over-quarter increase in sales to Chinese smartphone customers.翻译:阿蒙表示，他预计华为重新进入市场不会影响其与中国智能手机公司的关系，首席财务官阿卡什·帕尔希瓦拉(Akash Palkhiwala)预计，对中国智能手机客户的销售额将环比增长35%。

Analysts also expect major Qualcomm customer Samsung Electronics (005930.KS) to resume using some of its own in-house chips after using all Qualcomm chips in its most recent devices. Amon said the company expects to retain a "majority share" of the chips in Samsung's forthcoming S24 line of phones.翻译:分析师还预计，高通的主要客户三星电子（005930.KS）在其最新设备中使用所有高通芯片后，将恢复使用一些自己的内部芯片。阿蒙表示，该公司预计将保留三星即将推出的 S24 系列手机芯片的“多数份额”。

A broader turnaround in key consumer electronics markets could overcome those concerns. After large declines for several quarters, global smartphone shipments fell only 0.1% in the quarter ended September, thanks to strong emerging market demand and a resilient premium phone market, according to analysts at research firm IDC.翻译:主要消费电子市场的更广泛的转变可能会克服这些担忧。研究公司 IDC 的分析师表示，在经历了几个季度的大幅下滑后，全球智能手机出货量在截至 9 月份的季度仅下降了 0.1%，这得益于强劲的新兴市场需求和富有弹性的高端手机市场。

"For Qualcomm, it is a recovery in Android demand mostly driven by significant growth in demand from Chinese OEMs," said Logan Purk, analyst at Edward Jones. "This recovery would eventually happen but appears to have materialized sooner than expected, driving solid results and improved guidance for the next quarter."翻译:Edward Jones 分析师 Logan Purk 表示：“对于高通来说，Android 需求的复苏主要是由中国 OEM 厂商的需求大幅增长推动的。” “这种复苏最终会发生，但似乎比预期更早实现，推动了稳健的业绩并改善了下一季度的指导。”

Qualcomm said in September it signed a fresh supply agreement with iPhone maker Apple (AAPL.O) that runs to 2026. Last week it disclosed plans for a renewed push into the laptop market with backing from Microsoft (MSFT.O).翻译:高通公司在 9 月表示，它与 iPhone 制造商苹果公司(AAPL.O)签署了一份新的供应协议，有效期至 2026 年。上周，高通公司披露了在微软(MSFT.O)的支持下重新进军笔记本电脑市场的计划。

Fourth-quarter sales in Qualcomm's chip unit were $7.4 billion, beating analysts' estimate of $7.26 billion according to FactSet data. In Qualcomm's intellectual property licensing business, sales of $1.26 billion were in line with estimates of $1.25 billion according to FactSet data.翻译:FactSet 数据显示，高通芯片部门第四季度销售额为 74 亿美元，超过分析师预期的 72.6 亿美元。 FactSet 数据显示，高通知识产权授权业务销售额为 12.6 亿美元，与预期的 12.5 亿美元相符。

In its chip business, Qualcomm said fourth-quarter revenue from smartphone handsets was $5.46 billion, beating analysts' expectations of $5.34 billion according to FactSet data.翻译:在芯片业务方面，高通表示，根据 FactSet 数据，第四季度智能手机营收为 54.6 亿美元，超出分析师预期的 53.4 亿美元。

Automotive chip sales were $535 million in the fourth quarter, above estimates of $482 million according to FactSet. Overall, Qualcomm said its automotive chip business was up 24% for fiscal 2023 at $1.9 billion.翻译:FactSet 的数据显示，第四季度汽车芯片销售额为 5.35 亿美元，高于预期的 4.82 亿美元。总体而言，高通表示，2023 财年其汽车芯片业务增长 24%，达到 19 亿美元。

Reporting by Chavi Mehta in Bengaluru and Stephen Nellis in San Francisco; Editing by Richard Chang翻译:Chavi Mehta 在班加罗尔和 Stephen Nellis 在旧金山的报道；编辑：张理查德

item.title: 早盘竞价：美联储宽松政策提振风险偏好
item.description:
A look at the day ahead in Asian markets from Jamie McGeever, financial markets columnist.翻译:金融市场专栏作家杰米·麦克吉弗 (Jamie McGeever) 对亚洲市场未来一天的展望。

Asian markets are set to open higher on Thursday, lifted by Wall Street's surge the day before as investors' dovish interpretation of Fed chief Jerome Powell's post-meeting press conference pushed U.S. Treasury yields to a two-week low.翻译:由于投资者对美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔会后新闻发布会的鸽派解读，推动美国国债收益率跌至两周低点，受前一天华尔街股市飙升的提振，亚洲市场周四开盘走高。

The Asian and Pacific economic calendar on Thursday is light on quantity but fairly heavy on significance - South Korean inflation and Australian trade are the main indicators, while the policy highlight is the Malaysian central bank's interest rate decision.翻译:周四的亚太经济日历数量较少，但意义重大——韩国通胀和澳大利亚贸易是主要指标，而政策亮点是马来西亚央行的利率决定。

Investors will also continue to digest the fallout from the Bank of Japan's decision to scrap its 1% ceiling for the 10-year bond yield - on Wednesday the BOJ waded into the bond market, the yen recouped some ground after hitting a one-year low and the Nikkei leaped 2.4% for its third best day of year.翻译:投资者还将继续消化日本央行决定取消10年期债券收益率1%上限的影响——周三日本央行涉足债市，日元触及一年低点后收复部分失地日经指数上涨 2.4%，创今年第三佳日。

Wednesday's global market action should set the tone for Asia on Thursday. The MSCI World equity index rose just over 1%, its best day since August while the Nasdaq jumped 1.6%, its fourth rise in a row, for its best day since August too.翻译:周三的全球市场走势将为周四的亚洲市场定下基调。 MSCI 世界股票指数上涨略高于 1%，为 8 月以来的最佳单日表现，而纳斯达克指数则上涨 1.6%，为连续第四次上涨，也是 8 月以来的最佳单日表现。

The 10-year Treasury yield plunged 14 basis points, its biggest fall since March.翻译:10年期国债收益率暴跌14个基点，创3月份以来最大跌幅。

While Powell kept the door open to further tightening, markets judged he was not quite as hawkish as he might have been. If that is still the prevailing mood in Asia on Thursday, markets across the continent should benefit.翻译:尽管鲍威尔对进一步紧缩政策持开放态度，但市场判断他并不像他应有的那么鹰派。如果周四亚洲仍然普遍存在这种情绪，那么整个非洲大陆的市场都应该受益。

Sentiment toward Chinese markets may be less bullish, however.翻译:然而，对中国市场的情绪可能不那么乐观。

China's short-term money rates have soared, notably among non-bank financial institutions, and overnight borrowing costs for some Chinese financial institutions have jumped to as high as 50% as a month-end scramble for cash squeezed liquidity and stressed money markets.翻译:中国的短期货币利率飙升，尤其是非银行金融机构的利率飙升，一些中国金融机构的隔夜借款成本已跃升至50%，因为月底现金争夺战导致流动性紧张，货币市场承压。

On the economic front, China's factory activity unexpectedly contracted in October, renewing concerns over the state of the country's fragile economic recovery at the start of the fourth quarter, despite the better-than-expected third-quarter GDP figures a few weeks ago.翻译:经济方面，尽管几周前第三季度GDP数据好于预期，但中国10月份工厂活动意外收缩，再次引发人们对第四季度初经济复苏脆弱状况的担忧。

Uncertainty continues to swirl around the creaking property sector, where developer Evergrande has proposed a new debt restructuring plan for offshore bondholders, offering to swap their debts into about a 30% equity stake in each of the developer's two Hong Kong-listed subsidiaries.翻译:摇摇欲坠的房地产行业继续笼罩着不确定性，开发商恒大集团向境外债券持有人提出了一项新的债务重组计划，提出将其债务转换成该开发商两家香港上市子公司各约30%的股权。

In South Korea, figures on Thursday are expected to show annual inflation eased back to 3.60% in October from 3.70%, which would offer some relief to policymakers after it accelerated from July's two-year low of 2.30%.翻译:在韩国，周四公布的数据预计将显示 10 月份年度通胀率从 3.70% 回落至 3.60%，这将给政策制定者带来一些安慰，因为该国通胀率从 7 月份的两年低点 2.30% 加速上升。

Malaysia's central bank is expected to keep its key interest rate at 3% and through 2024, despite a weakening ringgit, amid stable domestic inflation and a steady growth outlook.翻译:尽管令吉走弱，但在国内通胀稳定和增长前景稳定的情况下，马来西亚央行预计将在 2024 年之前将关键利率维持在 3%。

Inflation is currently 1.9%, its lowest since March 2021 and far below the government's estimate of 2.5% to 3% for this year, so the central bank has a bit of room to stay on hold, and wait and see.翻译:目前通胀率为1.9%，为2021年3月以来的最低水平，远低于政府预计的今年2.5%至3%，因此央行还有一定的按兵不动、观望的空间。

Here are key developments that could provide more direction to markets on Thursday:翻译:以下是周四可能为市场提供更多方向的关键进展：

- Malaysia interest rate decision翻译:- 马来西亚利率决定

- South Korea CPI inflation (October)翻译:- 韩国CPI通胀（10月）

- Australia trade (October)翻译:- 澳大利亚贸易（十月）

item.title: 巴拿马抗议者挖坑，矿工第一量子公司面临崎岖道路
item.description:
Battered Canadian mining company First Quantum Minerals (FM.TO) is bracing for a rocky road ahead as Panama moves to strike down its contract to operate one of the world's largest copper mines.翻译:随着巴拿马取消其运营全球最大铜矿之一的合同，遭受重创的加拿大矿业公司第一量子矿业(FM.TO)正准备迎接一条崎岖的道路。

Panama's shock decision on Sunday to call a binding vote on whether to scrap the mine's recently struck 20-year contract sparked a sell-off in Vancouver-based First Quantum shares. Investors wiped out about C$8.35 billion ($6 billion), or 48%, from the company's market value this week, registering doubts about First Quantum's ability to operate its crown jewel.翻译:巴拿马周日令人震惊地决定就是否废除该矿最近签订的 20 年合同进行具有约束力的投票，引发了总部位于温哥华的第一量子股票的抛售。本周，投资者损失了该公司市值约 83.5 亿加元（60 亿美元），即 48%，对第一量子运营这颗皇冠上的明珠的能力表示怀疑。

President Laurentino Cortizo's decision to call the referendum followed days of protests by thousands of people over concerns the contract is too favorable to First Quantum, involved corruption, and that the mine is harmful to the environment.翻译:总统劳伦蒂诺·科尔蒂索决定召开公投，此前数天，数千人抗议该合同对第一量子公司过于有利、涉及腐败以及该矿对环境有害。

First Quantum on Tuesday reaffirmed its commitment to the rule of law with the objective of benefiting Panama. First Quantum and its local unit Minera Panama declined to comment further.翻译:第一量子周二重申其对法治的承诺，旨在使巴拿马受益。第一量子及其当地子公司巴拿马矿业公司拒绝进一步置评。

The government is also promoting a bill in Congress to overrule the law enacting the contract and ban all future concessions. Panama's top court has also agreed to consider six lawsuits challenging the contract.翻译:政府还在国会推动一项法案，推翻颁布合同的法律并禁止未来的所有让步。巴拿马最高法院也同意考虑六起对该合同提出质疑的诉讼。

The stakes are high for both First Quantum and Panama's economy. A decision to cancel the Cobre Panama mine's contract could slow Panama's GDP growth from an anticipated 6% in 2023 to just 1% without the mine in operation on an annualized basis.翻译:对于第一量子和巴拿马经济来说，风险都很大。如果取消巴拿马 Cobre 矿山合同，巴拿马的 GDP 增长率可能会从 2023 年预期的 6% 放缓至该矿山不运营的年化增长率仅为 1%。

The mine, which accounts for approximately 5% of the country's GDP and supports more than 49,000 direct and indirect jobs, is Panama's second-largest revenue source after the Panama Canal.翻译:该矿约占该国 GDP 的 5%，支持超过 49,000 个直接和间接就业岗位，是巴拿马仅次于巴拿马运河的第二大收入来源。

The odds of Panama losing its investment-grade rating would rise significantly if the contract is revoked, J.P Morgan warned on Tuesday. Despite that risk, protests calling for the contract's termination persist.翻译:摩根大通周二警告称，如果合同被撤销，巴拿马失去投资级评级的可能性将大幅上升。尽管存在这种风险，要求终止合同的抗议活动仍然存在。

Panama should not be "sold for a few cents," said protester Adriana Linares. "People on the street have a very clear objective, which is to strike down the approved contract."翻译:抗议者阿德里亚娜·利纳雷斯表示，巴拿马不应该“以几美分的价格出售”。 “街上的人有一个非常明确的目标，那就是推翻已经批准的合同。”

The government has not commented on whether the mine must cease production if the contract is rejected.翻译:政府尚未评论如果合同被拒绝该矿是否必须停止生产。

A spokesperson for Canada's Global Affairs department, in an email to Reuters, said Canada has consistently advocated for a resolution that benefits all Panamanians and is monitoring the situation.翻译:加拿大全球事务部发言人在给路透社的电子邮件中表示，加拿大一贯主张制定一项有利于所有巴拿马人的决议，并正在监测局势。

The mine, which opened in 2019, accounts for 1% of global copper production and cost $11 billion to build. It is considered important to the global energy transition because of its long life of at least 20 years, with copper being an important metal in making electric-vehicle batteries.翻译:该矿于 2019 年开业，占全球铜产量的 1%，建设成本 110 亿美元。由于其至少 20 年的使用寿命，铜被认为对全球能源转型非常重要，而铜是制造电动汽车电池的重要金属。

NOT FOLLOWING ANY PLAYBOOK

At least half a dozen analysts downgraded the stock this week.翻译:本周至少有六位分析师下调了该股的评级。

"This process is not following any playbook that we have seen before." said Jackie Przybylowski, a mining analyst with Bank of Montreal.翻译:“这个过程没有遵循我们以前见过的任何剧本。”蒙特利尔银行矿业分析师 Jackie Przybylowski 表示。

The number of workers per shift has been reduced at the mine due to food shortages prompted by road blockades and protests, Michael Camacho, a leader of the mine's workers union told Reuters.翻译:该矿工会领导人迈克尔·卡马乔告诉路透社，由于道路封锁和抗议导致食品短缺，该矿每班工人人数已经减少。

Panamanians are set to elect a new president and renew the seats of Congress and local governments in May 2024.翻译:巴拿马人将于 2024 年 5 月选举新总统并更新国会和地方政府席位。

"The timing has been highly unfavorable," former Finance and Economy Minister Frank De Lima told Reuters, adding the scenario could be different if it was not for the upcoming election.翻译:前财政和经济部长弗兰克·德利马对路透社表示：“时机非常不利。”他补充说，如果不是即将举行的选举，情况可能会有所不同。

Most presidential candidates backed the approval of a contract during its negotiations. Members of the ruling party currently hold the majority of the seats in Congress, and backed the new contract.翻译:大多数总统候选人在谈判期间支持批准合同。执政党成员目前在国会中占有多数席位，并支持新合同。

Independent lawmaker Juan Diego Vasquez, who did not support the contract, told Reuters the ongoing demonstrations show "Panamanians have understood well the damage that having bad lawmakers can do," adding the protests will influence the outcome of next election.翻译:不支持该合同的独立议员胡安·迭戈·瓦斯克斯对路透社表示，正在进行的示威活动表明“巴拿马人很清楚不良立法者可能造成的损害”，并补充说抗议活动将影响下次选举的结果。

Another independent lawmaker, Edison Broce, told Reuters that open-pit metal mining is damaging to Panama's environment, and it should focus on boosting its tourism industry.翻译:另一位独立议员爱迪生·布罗斯告诉路透社，露天金属开采正在破坏巴拿马的环境，应该重点发展旅游业。

Broce is vouching for an orderly and gradual complete shutdown of the mine, as "costs of mining outweigh its benefits."翻译:布罗斯保证将有序、逐步地完全关闭该矿，因为“采矿的成本超过了其收益”。

($1 = 1.3875 Canadian dollars)翻译:（1 美元 = 1.3875 加元）

item.title: 拥堵的波哥大为第二条地铁线获得了 4.15 亿美元的 IDB 信贷
item.description:
The board of directors of the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) on Wednesday approved a $415 million credit line, with an initial disbursement of $50 million, to finance Bogota's second metro line, the Colombian capital's mayor said.翻译:哥伦比亚首都波哥大市长表示，美洲开发银行 (IDB) 董事会周三批准了 4.15 亿美元的信贷额度，初步拨付 5000 万美元，为波哥大第二条地铁线提供资金。

The underground Line 2 will connect to the city's west, said Mayor Claudia Lopez, who finishes her term this year after overseeing initial construction on Bogota's long-awaited first metro line.翻译:市长克劳迪娅·洛佩兹 (Claudia Lopez) 表示，地铁 2 号线将连接该市的西部。她在监督波哥大期待已久的第一条地铁线的初步建设后，于今年结束了自己的任期。

"This line of credit adds to the $50 million signed this year with the European Investment Bank and to the $255 million framework financing agreement signed with the Development Bank of Latin America (CAF)," said Lopez, adding that the financing reflects investor confidence in funding sustainable transport in traffic-clogged Bogota.翻译:洛佩兹表示：“这一信贷额度是今年与欧洲投资银行签署的 5000 万美元以及与拉丁美洲开发银行 (CAF) 签署的 2.55 亿美元框架融资协议的基础上增加的。”他补充说，这笔融资反映了投资者对为交通拥堵的波哥大的可持续交通提供资金。

At a price tag of 34.9 trillion Colombian pesos ($8.5 billion), Line 2 is expected to benefit nearly 2.5 million inhabitants and stretch 15.5 kilometers (9.63 miles) connecting 11 stations.翻译:2 号线耗资 34.9 万亿哥伦比亚比索（85 亿美元），预计将使近 250 万居民受益，全长 15.5 公里（9.63 英里），连接 11 个车站。

The line will be awarded via a tender process next year.翻译:该生产线将于明年通过招标程序授予。

Line 1, currently being constructed by Chinese companies Harbor Engineering Company and Xi'an Metro Co., extends 23.9 kilometers overground - despite opposition by President Gustavo Petro, who wanted part of the line to be constructed underground.翻译:1号线目前由中国港湾工程公司和西安地铁公司承建，地上延伸23.9公里，尽管总统古斯塔沃·佩特罗反对，他希望部分线路建在地下。

The first line's total cost is estimated at 13.8 trillion pesos.翻译:第一条线的总成本估计为 13.8 万亿比索。

The metro is considered critical to reducing the chaotic traffic in the capital of more than eight million residents and will complement the existing TransMilenio bus system.翻译:该地铁被认为对于减少首都超过 800 万居民的混乱交通至关重要，并将补充现有的 TransMilenio 公交系统。

($1 = 4,108.40 Colombian pesos)翻译:（1 美元 = 4,108.40 哥伦比亚比索）

item.title: 美国众议院小组寻求禁止联邦政府购买中国无人机
item.description:
The top members of a U.S. House committee on China are introducing a bill that seeks to ban the U.S. government from buying Chinese drones.翻译:美国众议院中国问题委员会的高级成员正在提出一项法案，旨在禁止美国政府购买中国无人机。

Mike Gallagher, the Republican chair of the committee, and Raja Krishnamoorthi, the ranking Democrat, are introducing the "American Security Drone Act" on Wednesday, the lawmakers said in a statement to Reuters.翻译:立法者在给路透社的一份声明中表示，该委员会的共和党主席迈克·加拉格尔（Mike Gallagher）和民主党资深人士拉贾·克里希纳莫蒂（Raja Krishnamoorthi）将于周三推出“美国安全无人机法案”。

"This bill would prohibit the federal government from using American taxpayer dollars to purchase this equipment from countries like China," Gallagher said. "It is imperative that Congress pass this bipartisan bill to protect U.S. interests and our national security supply chain."翻译:加拉格尔说：“该法案将禁止联邦政府使用美国纳税人的钱从中国等国家购买这种设备。” “国会必须通过这项两党法案，以保护美国的利益和我们的国家安全供应链。”

The bill would also bar local and state governments from purchasing Chinese drones using federal grants and require a federal report detailing the amount of foreign commercial off-the-shelf drones and covered unmanned aircraft systems procured by federal departments and agencies from China.翻译:该法案还将禁止地方和州政府使用联邦拨款购买中国无人机，并要求联邦报告详细说明联邦部门和机构从中国采购的外国商业现成无人机和涵盖的无人机系统的数量。

Krishnamoorthi said the bill "helps protect against any vulnerabilities posed by our government agencies’ reliance on foreign-manufactured drone technology and will encourage growth in the U.S. drone industry."翻译:克里希纳莫蒂表示，该法案“有助于防止我们的政府机构依赖外国制造的无人机技术而造成的任何漏洞，并将鼓励美国无人机行业的增长。”

Separately, the U.S. Senate on Tuesday unanimously approved an amendment proposed by Republican Senator Marsha Blackburn and Democrat Mark Warner that would prohibit the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) from operating or providing federal funds for drones produced in China, Russia, Iran, North Korea, Venezuela or Cuba.翻译:另外，美国参议院周二一致批准了共和党参议员玛莎·布莱克本和民主党人马克·沃纳提出的一项修正案，该修正案将禁止联邦航空管理局（FAA）为中国、俄罗斯、伊朗、朝鲜生产的无人机运营或提供联邦资金。委内瑞拉或古巴。

“Taxpayer dollars should never fund drones manufactured in regions that are hostile toward our nation,” Blackburn said.翻译:布莱克本说：“纳税人的钱永远不应该资助在对我们国家怀有敌意的地区制造的无人机。”

China recently announced export controls on some drones and drone-related equipment, saying it wanted to safeguard "national security and interests."翻译:中国最近宣布对一些无人机和无人机相关设备实施出口管制，称其希望维护“国家安全和利益”。

The Commerce Department in 2020 imposed export restrictions on China-based drone manufacturer DJI, accusing it of complicity in the oppression of China's Uyghur minority and helping the military.翻译:美国商务部于 2020 年对中国无人机制造商大疆创新实施了出口限制，指责其共谋压迫中国维吾尔少数民族并帮助军方。

Over 50% of drones sold in the United States are made by DJI, and they are the most popular drones in use by public safety agencies, Republican lawmakers said earlier this year.翻译:共和党议员今年早些时候表示，美国销售的无人机中有超过 50% 由大疆创新制造，它们是公共安全机构最受欢迎的无人机。

Congress in 2019 banned the Pentagon from buying or using drones and components manufactured in China.翻译:国会于2019年禁止五角大楼购买或使用中国制造的无人机及零部件。

Reporting by David Shepardson in Washington Devika Nair in Bengaluru; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama and Mark Porter翻译:大卫·谢泼德森 (David Shepardson) 华盛顿报道 德维卡·奈尔 (Devika Nair) 班加罗尔报道；编辑：野山千津和马克·波特

item.title: 中国与俄罗斯顶级能源公司讨论开发油气田 - CNPC
item.description:
Summary:
  • This content was produced in Russia where the law restricts coverage of Russian military operations in Ukraine翻译:此内容在俄罗斯制作，该国法律限制报道俄罗斯在乌克兰的军事行动

China is in talks with Russia's Rosneft (ROSN.MM), Gazprom (GAZP.MM) and Novatek (NVTK.MM) about the joint development of oil and gas fields and hydrocarbon trade, state-owned China National Petroleum Corporation (CNPC) said on Wednesday.翻译:国有的中国石油天然气集团公司（CNPC）表示，中国正在与俄罗斯石油公司（ROSN.MM） 、俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（GAZP.MM）和诺瓦泰克公司（NVTK.MM）就联合开发油气田和碳氢化合物贸易进行谈判周三。

Russia is counting on a planned new pipeline to China as it seeks to make up for lost gas sales in Europe, but industry insiders see major political risks around a project that is overly dependent on one buyer and question whether it will justify the huge costs.翻译:俄罗斯正指望计划修建一条通往中国的新管道，以弥补欧洲天然气销售的损失，但业内人士认为，这一过度依赖单一买家的项目存在重大政治风险，并质疑其巨额成本是否合理。

"We are now discussing with Rosneft, Gazprom and Novatek questions on the joint development of oil and gas fields, widening the capacity of pipeline projects and trade of hydrocarbons," said CNPC Vice President Xie Jun at the St Petersburg International Gas Forum.翻译:中石油副总经理谢军在圣彼得堡国际天然气论坛上表示：“我们现在正在与俄罗斯石油公司、俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司和诺瓦泰克公司讨论联合开发油气田、扩大管道项目容量和碳氢化合物贸易的问题。”

CNPC and Gazprom are working on speeding up Russian gas supplies to China via the Far Eastern route, he added. Gazprom later said it had signed an agreement with the CNPC and PipeChina on design and construction of a pipeline section in the Far East.翻译:他补充说，中石油和俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司正在努力加快俄罗斯通过远东路线向中国供应天然气的速度。俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司随后表示，已与中国石油天然气集团公司和中国管道公司签署了一份关于远东管道段设计和施工的协议。

Russian gas supplies to China via the Power of Siberia pipeline began in December 2019 and are expected to reach the contractual level of 38 billion cubic metres (bcm) per year in 2025.翻译:俄罗斯通过西伯利亚力量管道向中国供应天然气于2019年12月开始，预计到2025年将达到每年380亿立方米的合同水平。

Gazprom signed a second contract to supply 10 bcm per year via the Far Eastern route in February 2022.翻译:俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司于 2022 年 2 月签署了第二份合同，每年通过远东航线供应 10 bcm。

Gazprom CEO Alexei Miller said the company was preparing to increase supplies to Central Asian countries Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan, and provide gas with cooperation for 15 years from 2024.翻译:俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司首席执行官阿列克谢·米勒表示，该公司准备增加对中亚国家乌兹别克斯坦、哈萨克斯坦和吉尔吉斯斯坦的供应，并从2024年开始提供为期15年的天然气合作。

Russia has been trying to redirect supplies to Asia since its major customers in Europe slashed Russian energy imports after Moscow launched what it calls a "special military operation" in Ukraine in February 2022.翻译:2022 年 2 月莫斯科在乌克兰发起所谓的“特别军事行动”后，俄罗斯在欧洲的主要客户大幅削减了俄罗斯能源进口，此后俄罗斯一直试图将供应转向亚洲。

Reporting by Oksana Kobzeva; Writing by Alexander Marrow, editing by David Evans翻译:奥克萨娜·科布泽娃 (Oksana Kobzeva) 报道；亚历山大·马罗撰稿，大卫·埃文斯编辑

item.title: 中国经济复苏缓慢，雅诗兰黛、加拿大鹅大幅削减年度目标
item.description:
Estee Lauder (EL.N) and Canada Goose Holdings (GOOS.TO), on Wednesday cut their annual forecasts as the luxury goods companies grapple with weak demand in high-growth market China.翻译:雅诗兰黛(EL.N)和加拿大鹅控股(GOOS.TO)周三下调了年度预期，因为这两家奢侈品公司正在努力应对高增长市场中国需求疲软的问题。

Estee's shares tumbled as much as 21% to hit an over six-year low of $102.22 while Canada Goose's stock shed 10%.翻译:雅诗兰黛 (Estee) 股价暴跌 21%，触及六年多低点 102.22 美元，而加拿大鹅 (Canada Goose) 股价下跌 10%。

Global companies ranging from L'Oreal (OREP.PA) to LVMH (LVMH.PA) have indicated that inflation and economic turmoil are curbing a post-pandemic spending spree, mainly in the world's second-largest economy China.翻译:欧莱雅(OREP.PA)和路威酩轩(LVMH.PA)等全球公司均表示，通胀和经济动荡正在抑制疫情后的消费热潮，尤其是在世界第二大经济体中国。

Luxury companies have also flagged a hit from Beijing's tighter controls of "daigou" resellers - people who buy items at lower prices abroad and resell them at a discount in the country.翻译:奢侈品公司还表示，北京对“代购”经销商的控制更加严格，这些经销商在国外以较低的价格购买商品，然后在国内以折扣价转售。

"They are very exposed to the daigou trade and are also big beneficiaries...the Chinese authorities have clearly clamped down on these bigger trades and it might have fundamentally changed the trade from here," said Javier Gonzalez Lastra, luxury-focused portfolio manager at Tema ETFs.翻译:专注于奢侈品的投资组合经理哈维尔·冈萨雷斯·拉斯特拉 (Javier Gonzalez Lastra) 表示：“他们在代购贸易中的风险敞口很大，也是大受益者……中国当局显然已经打压了这些规模更大的交易，这可能会从根本上改变目前的贸易状况。”在 Tema ETF。

Canada Goose, whose luxury parkas retail for over $1,000, said sales in China slowed in the second quarter from the preceding quarter, while Estee has struggled with a weaker-than-expected rebound in demand from fliers in Asia, mainly in travel destinations such as Korea and China's Hainan province.翻译:Canada Goose 的豪华派克大衣零售价超过 1,000 美元，该公司表示，第二季度在中国的销售较上一季度放缓，而雅诗兰黛 (Estee) 则因亚洲旅客需求反弹弱于预期而陷入困境，主要是在亚洲等旅游目的地韩国和中国海南省。

"Their (Canada Goose's) Chinese business has not gone back to what they would have anticipated at this point...," said Cole Smead of Smead Capital Management. "The people selling the stock today are just saying in the interim they do not think it is going to recover anytime soon."翻译:Smead Capital Management 的科尔·斯米德 (Cole Smead) 表示：“他们（加拿大鹅）的中国业务目前尚未恢复到他们预期的水平……”。 “今天出售该股票的人只是说，他们认为该股票暂时不会很快复苏。”

Smead Capital owns Canada Goose shares in its International Value portfolio.翻译:Smead Capital 持有其 International Value 投资组合中的 Canada Goose 股票。

Estee signaled that a resetting of inventory in Asia travel retail is expected to extend until the end of the third quarter of its financial year 2024.翻译:雅诗兰黛表示，亚洲旅游零售的库存重置预计将持续到2024财年第三季度末。

Duty-free retailer Dufry (DUFN.S) is expected to give a clearer picture of travel retail growth when it reports quarterly results on Thursday.翻译:免税零售商 Dufry (DUFN.S)预计将在周四报告季度业绩时给出更清晰的旅游零售增长情况。

Estee now expects adjusted profit per share between $2.17 and $2.42 for its full year, compared to a prior forecast of $3.50 to $3.75. It said disruptions caused by the conflict in the Middle East could have an 8 cents per share impact on profit.翻译:雅诗兰黛目前预计全年调整后每股利润在 2.17 美元至 2.42 美元之间，而之前的预测为 3.50 美元至 3.75 美元。该公司表示，中东冲突造成的中断可能会对每股利润产生 8 美分的影响。

Annual sales are estimated to decrease 2% to an increase of 1%, compared with a rise of between 5% and 7% earlier.翻译:年销售额预计将下降 2% 至增长 1%，而之前的增幅为 5% 至 7%。

Canada Goose expects 2024 revenue to be between C$1.20 billion ($864.49 million) and C$1.40 billion, compared to C$1.40 billion to C$1.50 billion estimated earlier.翻译:Canada Goose 预计 2024 年收入将在 12 亿加元（8.6449 亿美元）至 14 亿加元之间，而之前估计为 14 亿加元至 15 亿加元。

Annual adjusted profit is expected to be between C$0.60 and C$1.40 per share, compared to the prior range of C$1.20 to C$1.48.翻译:调整后的年度利润预计为每股 0.60 加元至 1.40 加元，而之前的范围为 1.20 加元至 1.48 加元。

Canada Goose also posted a nearly 11% decline in revenue in the United States region, on strained demand for high-end goods while Estee, seen as an affordable luxury, posted an 8% increase in sales in the Americas.翻译:由于高端商品需求紧张，加拿大鹅 (Canada Goose) 在美国地区的收入也下降了近 11%，而被视为平价奢侈品的雅诗兰黛 (Estee) 在美洲的销售额则增长了 8%。

($1 = 1.3881 Canadian dollars)翻译:（1 美元 = 1.3881 加元）

item.title: 苹果的假日季度预测面临华为和中国市场疲软的威胁
item.description:
Apple investors will have one big question when the world's most valuable company reports earnings on Thursday - will Huawei's resurgence in China dampen its holiday-quarter expectations?翻译:当全球最有价值的公司周四公布财报时，苹果投资者将面临一个大问题——华为在中国的复兴是否会削弱其假日季度的预期？

The company, which will post results for the July-September period, is grappling with an uneven recovery in the world's second-largest economy and tougher competition from Huawei after the Chinese firm's new Mate 60 Pro series phones saw strong early sales.翻译:该公司将于 7 月至 9 月公布业绩，该公司正在努力应对世界第二大经济体复苏不平衡的问题，以及在华为新款 Mate 60 Pro 系列手机早期销售强劲后来自华为的更激烈竞争。

Apple's (AAPL.O) own iPhone 15 line-up has gotten off to a slow start in the crucial international market. Counterpoint estimates China sales of the latest series were nearly 5% lower compared with the iPhone 14 in the first 17 days after launch.翻译:苹果(AAPL.O)自己的 iPhone 15 系列在重要的国际市场上起步缓慢。 Counterpoint 估计，最新系列在推出后的前 17 天内，与 iPhone 14 相比，在中国的销量下降了近 5%。

"Strength of the iPhone 15 cycle is the key question heading into the December quarter," Bernstein analysts said, adding that they expected "muted" sales of the device due to a lack of new features, strained consumer spending and competition from Huawei.翻译:Bernstein 分析师表示：“iPhone 15 周期的强劲程度是进入 12 月份季度的关键问题。”他补充说，由于缺乏新功能、消费者支出紧张以及来自华为的竞争，他们预计该设备的销售将“低迷”。

Huawei sold 1.6 million units of its Mate 60 Pro in six weeks, and brokerages such as Jefferies have said the firm could take back much of the market share in the coming years it lost to Apple after U.S. sanctions in 2019 hammered its business.翻译:华为在六周内售出了 160 万部 Mate 60 Pro ，杰富瑞 (Jefferies) 等券商表示，在 2019 年美国制裁对其业务造成重创后，该公司可能会在未来几年夺回被苹果夺走的大部分市场份额。

Those fears, as well as a wider pullback in tech stocks due to high interest rates, knocked Apple shares down nearly 14% in the three months to October-end, compared with the tech-heavy Nasdaq's (.IXIC) 11% decline in the same period.翻译:这些担忧，以及高利率导致科技股大幅回调，导致苹果股价在截至 10 月底的三个月内下跌了近 14%，而以科技股为主的纳斯达克指数(.IXIC)在 2019 年 11 月的跌幅为 11%。同一时期。

But there are signs of an economic pick up in China. Data released last month showed the economy grew at a faster-than-expected clip of 4.9% in the third quarter - though less than the 6.3% expansion in the second quarter - while consumption and industrial activity also surprised on the upside in September.翻译:但中国经济出现回暖迹象。上个月公布的数据显示，第三季度经济增长 4.9%，快于预期，但低于第二季度 6.3% 的增速，而 9 月份消费和工业活动也出现意外增长。

The July-September period marks Apple's fiscal fourth quarter, and the company is expected to lay down a percentage target for sales growth for the October-December period - its fiscal first quarter that covers holiday-season shopping.翻译:7 月至 9 月是苹果公司的第四财季，预计该公司将为 10 月至 12 月期间的销售增长制定百分比目标，该公司第一财季涵盖假日季购物。

Wall Street analysts expect iPhone sales to rise about 6% in the October-December period, according to LSEG data. That is well below historical levels - barring 2022's holiday season quarter when Chinese COVID-19 curbs curtailed production of high-end iPhones, the average holiday quarter sales growth for the device has been 9.2% in the past four years.翻译:根据 LSEG 的数据，华尔街分析师预计 10 月至 12 月期间 iPhone 销量将增长约 6%。这远低于历史水平 - 除非 2022 年假日季季度中国因新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 疫情限制了高端 iPhone 的产量，否则过去四年该设备假日季度的平均销量增长率为 9.2%。

However, the fiscal first-quarter projections suggest an improvement from an estimated increase of 2.8% for the three months ended September, marking the largest rise in iPhone sales since the start of this year.翻译:然而，第一财季预测显示，截至 9 月份的三个月的预计增幅为 2.8%，有所改善，这标志着 iPhone 销量出现今年年初以来的最大增幅。

Overall revenue is still expected to tick down nearly 1%, dragged by continued weakness in sales of the iPad and Mac, which are expected to fall 15% and 25%, respectively.翻译:受 iPad 和 Mac 销量持续疲软的拖累，整体收入预计仍将下降近 1%，预计分别下降 15% 和 25%。

Apple earlier this week unveiled new MacBook Pro and iMac computers and three new chips to power them. The machines aimed at professional users, come at a time when the PC market is showing signs of a pick up after its over two-years-long slump.翻译:苹果公司本周早些时候推出了新款 MacBook Pro 和 iMac 电脑以及为其提供动力的三款新芯片。这些针对专业用户的机器推出之际，个人电脑市场在经历了两年多的低迷之后出现了回升的迹象。

The decline in global PC shipments slowed for a third straight quarter in the July-September period, a sign that the market has bottomed out, according to research firm IDC.翻译:研究公司 IDC 的数据显示，7 月至 9 月期间，全球个人电脑出货量下降幅度连续第三个季度放缓，这表明市场已经触底。

The global smartphone market contracted 8% in this period, according to Counterpoint.翻译:据 Counterpoint 称，同期全球智能手机市场萎缩了 8%。

The company's services business will likely be a bright spot, with estimated growth of 11.3%. The segment has often outpaced growth in Apple's hardware business in recent years and now accounts for nearly a quarter of its total revenue.翻译:公司的服务业务将可能成为亮点，预计增长11.3%。近年来，该领域的增长速度往往超过了苹果硬件业务的增长，目前占其总收入的近四分之一。
